On Tue, 2005-07-05 at 23:35, Gordon Mohr wrote:
> Yes. The primary aim was to place the most important and compact
> numeric info to the left, where it would not scroll/line-wrap off
> the right margin. (The 'host' info remains more understandable if
> ever partially-obscured by right margin issues, and this arrangement
> obviates the need for a once-through survey of all hosts to find
> the 'longest' before writing any line.)
> 
> Some of the other similar reports have been changed the same way.
> 
> Pretty-printed alignment of the first few compact columns could be
> restored; is it important?

Not for us, we do machine-parsing which just splits by whitespace.  It
got rather confused trying to parse the new format:)

-Lars
